Callback.description: Subscribe to receive callbacks when specific system events occur

on.description: Receive callbacks only for these system events

queue.description: Store callbacks in a queue. Used when a customer cannot receive callbacks but can poll xMatters systems to retrieve them.

script.description: Integration script to execute when this callback fires

Device.description: A device in xMatters is any means of receiving a notification message. Devices can include physical items like phones, or intangible items such as email accounts.

conferences.description: Set this value to the name of an existing conference bridge, or leave it empty to create a new xMatters-hosted conference bridge.

responseOptions.description: A list of the response options to be displayed for the event. Response options are identified by a Universally Unique Identifier (UUID).

Event.description: An event represents a situation that requires a notification. Event is also used to refer to an incident or situation as it progresses through the system, from injection to notification to resolution.

startTime.description: The start time of the event

count.description: Number of data items in this page of the result set

total.description: Total number of data items in the result set

EventPost.description: An event represents a situation that requires a notification. Event is also used to refer to an incident or situation as it progresses through the system, from injection to notification to resolution.

Group.description: Groups are used for collecting users and devices and organizing them into notification schedules.

useDefaultDevices.description: Indicates whether to use Group memberâ€™s default Devices when other Devices are not available.

allowDuplicates.description: Indicates whether the Group allows duplicate members.

observedByAll.description: Indicates whether all Roles can observe this Group.

Notification.description: A notification is any message sent by xMatters to a device, in order to inform a person of an event that requires attention. The alert contains information about the event, such the time and location, and may ask the person to respond, acknowledging that they have received the notification.

created.description: Date and time the notification was created

count.description: Number of data items in this page of the result set

total.description: Total number of data items in the result set

NotificationPost.description: A notification is any message sent by xMatters to a device, in order to inform a person of an event that requires attention. The alert contains information about the event, such the time and location, and may ask the person to respond, acknowledging that they have received the notification.

self.description: URL of this page of the result set

previous.description: URL of the previous page of the result set

Person.description: Someone in the xMatters system who can receive notifications is called a 'Person'. Every person in the xMatters system is a user defined by a set of details, including ID number, user name, login password, and so on.

total.description: Total number of data items in the result set

PersonPost.description: Someone in the xMatters system who can receive notifications is called a 'Person'. Every person in the xMatters system is a user defined by a set of details, including ID number, user name, login password, and so on.

Recipient.description: A Recipient can be the target of a notification. Groups, People and Devices are all Recipients

externallyOwned.description: Externally owned = false means that data locking in the Web UI will never take place for a record, regardless of the data locking configuration. Externally owned = true means that data locking in the Web UI will take place for a record, but only for the fields that have data locking enabled. These records can only be deleted via EPIC.

locked.description: When objects are in an externally owned state, locked controls which externally owned data fields users can change
